greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Write n = m^k with m, k integers, k >= 1, then a(n) = smallest possible choice for m.
comment: Value of m in m^p = n, where p is the largest possible power (see A052409).
For n > 1, n is a perfect power iff a(n) <> n. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Oct 13 2002
Every integer root of n is a power of a(n). All entries (except 1) belong to A007916. - _Gus Wiseman_, Sep 11 2017
link: Daniel Forgues, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..100000
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Perfect Power
program: (PARI) a(n) = if (ispower(n,,&r), r, n); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Jul 19 2017
results.author: _Eric W. Weisstein_
